author: catwith1hat
content:
<@905058765022310460> On your Holesky exit queue remark: Why is there the additional penalty for slashed validators to suffer on their way out? [`get_attestation_component_deltas`](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/phase0/beacon-chain.md#helpers) has:
```
    for index in get_eligible_validator_indices(state):
        if index in unslashed_attesting_indices:
            # ....
        else:
            penalties[index] += get_base_reward(state, index)
```
So slashed validators just get a penalty no matter what they do, right? Even if they vote correctly, they get the penalty applied. How much that is cummulatively depends on how full the exit queue is. Isn't that a bit random? We already have correlation penalties implemented in `process_slashings`.

author: catwith1hat
content: Let's assume that you end up on the minority chain, and that you attested correctly. Your goal is to burn as much ETH on the majority side as possible. One strategy would be to do a voluntary exit with your validators, such that you clog up the exit queue and amplify the pain when majority validator switch over to the minority chain.

author: parithosh
content: Once you're slashed you don't get any duties assigned to you though, so there's no penalties for missing duties you haven't been assigned (Afaik)

author: jgm
content:
You are still assigned duties (you're still active until you exit, and all active validators are assigned duties), but your attestations don't count so yes you are punished for it.

And yes it's a bit of an odd system.
